Pre-Game Insights: England and Scotland are finally going to play each other in a T20 International on June 4, 2024, in a World Cup.
England will return to Bridgetown, the venue of their first-ever ICC trophy win in 2010.
England come fresh off the lows of one of their worst World Cup campaigns in India.
Jos Buttler called the early elimination a 'low point' and aims to ensure a better World Cup defence.
England haven't enjoyed the best results in T20 format since the last T20 World Cup, losing 8 of their 14 matches.
Scotland made it to this World Cup after winning all six matches in the regional European Qualifiers.
The match is scheduled for June 4, 2024, at 10:30 AM LOCAL / 8:00 PM IST / 02:30 PM GMT at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados.
The pitch at Kensington Oval has been playing differently due to wet weather, with increasing help for spinners in the second innings.
England's middle-order has been a pain point, with a middle-order average of 22.28, ranking 13th among the 20 participating teams.
Scotland would look to attack England's middle order with spin, as several key England players have struggled against slower bowlers since 2022.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be Scotland's first T20I in the Caribbean.
Scotland have bowled first in just three of their 17 T20Is since January 2022, and each of their 10 wins in this period have come while batting first.
Jos Buttler stated there is no added pressure of being defending champions and emphasized playing their brand of cricket.
Richie Berrington highlighted the excitement of having more teams at the start of the tournament and the opportunity it presents.
